birth_context.metadata: 1990s: Lima felt post‑Cold‑War reordering, globalization, and early internet adoption alongside oscillating populism and economic volatility; locals commonly emphasized adaptability, new professional identities, and widening global outlooks and tight‑knit kinship and street‑level solidarity.

formative_context.metadata: 2000s: Dhaka felt accelerating globalization, mobile/internet mainstreaming, and security anxieties alongside rapid urban migration and bureaucratic expansion; locals commonly emphasized cosmopolitan networking, entrepreneurial hustle, and risk management in daily life and joint‑family ties, exam culture, and jugaad improvisation.

current_socio_demographics.societal_perceptions: as a multicultural immigrant professional, expected to be resilient but facing intersectional prejudice and limited mental health resources

presenting_problem.summary: profound adjustment difficulties after relocating to Karachi during pandemic lockdowns
